cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 15 mi (25 km) WSW of Marco Island, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the central Gulf Coast (near the Mississippi-Alabama border)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Gulf Coast, close to the MS-AL border (near the mouth of the Pearl River)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge watch west of Shell Beach LA to the mouth of the Mississippi River and east of the MS-AL border to Navarre FL; Hurricane watch mouth of Pearl River to AL-FL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm-surge warning Shell Beach LA to MS-AL border; Tropical-storm warning Golden Beach FL to Bonita Beach FL, Florida Keys, and from Okaloosa-Walton County line FL westward to east of Morgan City LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Florida, the Florida Keys, and the entire northern Gulf Coast from northwest Florida to southeast Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of tropical-storm-force gusts (30-40 mph) possible Monday afternoon and evening
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge inundation expected along the Port Manatee shoreline
weather_observation.rainfall: 2â€“4 inches of rain possible in outer rainbands Monday through early Tuesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in squalls Monday
